DataElement.preferredName: Person PARP1 Gene Inhibition Cyclophosphamide Exclusion Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown/not available indicator whether a person has received PARP inhibitors, an inhibitor of the nuclear enzyme poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase (PARP) with potential chemo- and/or radiosensitizing activity, in combination with cyclophosphamide, a synthetic alkylating agent chemically related to the nitrogen mustards with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities, as the medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person PARP1 Gene Inhibition Cyclophosphamide Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having received PARP inhibitors, an inhibitor of the nuclear enzyme poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase (PARP) with potential chemo- and/or radiosensitizing activity, in combination with cyclophosphamide, a synthetic alkylating agent chemically related to the nitrogen mustards with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities, as the medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Property.preferredName: PARP1 Gene Inhibition Cyclophosphamide Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in cellular repair and apoptosis.:The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.:A synthetic alkylating agent chemically related to the nitrogen mustards with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  In the liver, cyclophosphamide is converted to the active metabolites aldophosphamide and phosphoramide mustard, which bind to DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and initiating cell death. (NCI04):Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in cellular repair and apoptosis.
The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.

A synthetic alkylating agent chemically related to the nitrogen mustards with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities. In the liver, cyclophosphamide is converted to the active metabolites aldophosphamide and phosphoramide mustard, which bind to DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and initiating cell death.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has had prior treatment with
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has had prior treatment with any PARP inhibitors that were administered in combination with cyclophosphamide
